fields.name: airPollution
fields.description: Provides access to air pollution data, including current, forecast, and historical values.

fields.name: current
fields.description:
Fetch the current weather data for a specific latitude and longitude.

- `input`: Latitude and longitude coordinates for the city or location.
- `options`: Optional parameters like units and language.

The response includes information about temperature, wind speed, weather conditions, and more.

fields.name: forecast
fields.description: Provides weather forecasts for up to 30 days.

fields.name: geocoding
fields.description: Provides access to geocoding-related queries.

fields.name: roadRisk
fields.description:
Retrieves road risk information based on location and time.
This helps assess potential hazards such as slippery roads, fog, or other
weather-related risks that may affect driving conditions.

fields.name: trigger
fields.description: The trigger query allows you to fetch triggers and historical data related to weather conditions.

types.name: AirPollution
types.description: Provides air pollution data, including current, forecasted, and historical values.

fields.name: current
fields.description:
Retrieves current air pollution data based on latitude and longitude.
Returns pollutant concentrations and the Air Quality Index (AQI).

fields.name: forecast
fields.description:
Provides an air pollution forecast for the next few days
based on latitude and longitude.

fields.name: history
fields.description:
Fetches historical air pollution data for a given location and time range.
Useful for analyzing past air quality trends.

types.name: AirPollutionHistoryInput
types.description: Input parameters for retrieving historical air pollution data.

inputFields.name: end
inputFields.description: End timestamp in Unix format (UTC) for historical data retrieval.

inputFields.name: lat
inputFields.description: Latitude coordinate of the location.

inputFields.name: lon
inputFields.description: Longitude coordinate of the location.

inputFields.name: start
inputFields.description: Start timestamp in Unix format (UTC) for historical data retrieval.

types.name: AirPollutionList
types.description: Response object for air pollution data, including pollutant concentrations and AQI.

fields.name: components
fields.description: Concentration of various air pollutants at the recorded time.

fields.name: dt
fields.description: Timestamp in Unix format (UTC) representing the recorded air pollution data.

fields.name: main
fields.description: Overall air quality index (AQI) at the recorded time.

types.name: AirPollutionMain
types.description: Represents the overall air quality index (AQI).

fields.name: aqi
fields.description:
Air Quality Index (AQI) value.
- 1: Good
- 2: Fair
- 3: Moderate
- 4: Poor
- 5: Very Poor

types.name: AirPollutionPayload
types.description: Payload for air pollution data, including historical, current, or forecasted values.

fields.name: coord
fields.description: Coordinates of the location where air pollution data was retrieved.

fields.name: list
fields.description: A list of air pollution records containing pollutant concentrations and the Air Quality Index (AQI) at specific timestamps.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

fields.name: coord
fields.description: Coordinates of the city (latitude and longitude).

fields.name: country
fields.description: City country code (e.g., "US" for the United States, "IN" for India).

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique city identifier.
fields.deprecationReason: Please note that built-in geocoder functionality has been deprecated.

fields.name: name
fields.description: City name (e.g., "London").
fields.deprecationReason: Please note that built-in geocoder functionality has been deprecated.

fields.name: population
fields.description: City population (the number of people living in the city).

fields.name: sunrise
fields.description: The sunrise time in UTC (seconds since 1970-01-01).

fields.name: sunset
fields.description: The sunset time in UTC (seconds since 1970-01-01).

fields.name: timezone
fields.description: The timezone of the city, in UTC offset (e.g., 0 for UTC, -5 for Eastern Standard Time).

fields.name: all
fields.description: The cloudiness percentage, indicating the proportion of the sky covered by clouds.

types.name: Components
types.description:
Represents the concentration of various air pollutants in the atmosphere.
Measured in micrograms per cubic meter (µg/m³).

fields.name: co
fields.description: Carbon monoxide (CO) concentration in the air.

fields.name: nh3
fields.description: Ammonia (NH₃) concentration in the air.

fields.name: no
fields.description: Nitric oxide (NO) concentration in the air.

fields.name: no2
fields.description: Nitrogen dioxide (NO₂) concentration in the air.

fields.name: o3
fields.description: Ozone (O₃) concentration in the air.

fields.name: pm2_5
fields.description:
Particulate matter with a diameter of 2.5 micrometers or smaller (PM2.5).
Fine particles that can cause respiratory health issues.

fields.name: pm10
fields.description:
Particulate matter with a diameter of 10 micrometers or smaller (PM10).
Larger airborne particles that can affect air quality and health.

fields.name: so2
fields.description: Sulfur dioxide (SO₂) concentration in the air.

fields.name: _id
fields.description: The unique identifier for the condition.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The amount for the condition expression (e.g., a temperature threshold).

fields.name: expression
fields.description: The expression used to evaluate the condition (e.g., greater than, less than).

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the condition, e.g., "temperature", "humidity".

fields.name: lat
fields.description: City geographic location, expressed as latitude (y-axis).

fields.name: lon
fields.description: City geographic location, expressed as longitude (x-axis).

fields.name: base
fields.description: The base of the weather data, representing the measurement system used (e.g., "stations").

fields.name: clouds
fields.description: Cloudiness data, representing the percentage of the sky covered by clouds.

fields.name: cod
fields.description: The status code from the API response, where 200 is successful and other values represent errors.

fields.name: coord
fields.description: The coordinates of the location, including latitude and longitude.

fields.name: dt
fields.description: The time of the data calculation in UTC, expressed as a Unix timestamp.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for the city or location.

fields.name: main
fields.description: Main weather parameters, such as temperature, pressure, humidity, and others.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the city or location.

fields.name: rain
fields.description: Rain data, representing the rainfall in the last hour (if available).

fields.name: snow
fields.description: Snow data, representing the snowfall in the last hour (if available).

fields.name: sys
fields.description: The system information about the location, including sunrise and sunset times.

fields.name: timezone
fields.description: The timezone offset in seconds from UTC.

fields.name: visibility
fields.description: The visibility distance in meters.

fields.name: weather
fields.description: A list of weather conditions for the location, including weather type (e.g., clear, rainy, stormy).

fields.name: wind
fields.description: Wind data, including wind speed, direction, and gusts.

inputFields.name: lang
inputFields.description: The language in which the weather data should be returned (e.g., "en" for English, "fr" for French).

inputFields.name: units
inputFields.description: The unit system for the weather data. Can be "metric" (Celsius), "imperial" (Fahrenheit), or "standard" (Kelvin).

fields.name: one_hour
fields.description: The amount of rainfall over the last hour, measured in millimeters.

fields.name: one_hour
fields.description: The amount of snowfall over the last hour, measured in millimeters.

types.name: Direct
types.description: Represents location details retrieved using a direct search query.

fields.name: country
fields.description: Country code in ISO 3166 format.

fields.name: lat
fields.description: Latitude coordinate of the location.

fields.name: local_names
fields.description: Localized names of the location in various languages.

fields.name: lon
fields.description: Longitude coordinate of the location.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the location (e.g., city or town).

fields.name: state
fields.description: Name of the state or region where the location is situated.

types.name: DirectInput
types.description: Input parameters for direct geocoding queries.

inputFields.name: limit
inputFields.description: Limit the number of results returned (default: no limit).

inputFields.name: q
inputFields.description: Name of the location (e.g., city or town) to search for.

fields.name: day
fields.description: "Feels-like" temperature during the day, in degrees Celsius.

fields.name: eve
fields.description: "Feels-like" temperature during the evening, in degrees Celsius.

fields.name: morn
fields.description: "Feels-like" temperature during the morning, in degrees Celsius.

fields.name: night
fields.description: "Feels-like" temperature during the night, in degrees Celsius.

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

fields.name: five
fields.description:
5 day forecast is available at any location on the globe. It includes weather forecast data with 3-hour step.

Parameters:
- `input`: The latitude and longitude of the location.
- `options`: Additional parameters like units and language.

fields.name: hourly
fields.description:
Hourly forecast for 4 days (96 timestamps).
Provides temperature, humidity, wind speed, and weather conditions for each hour.

args.name: input
args.description: Latitude and longitude coordinates of the location.

args.name: options
args.description: Additional options such as units, language, and forecast hours count.

fields.name: sixteen
fields.description: Retrieves a 16-day weather forecast based on latitude and longitude.

args.name: input
args.description: Latitude and longitude coordinates of the location.

args.name: options
args.description: Additional options such as units, language, and forecast days count.

fields.name: thirty
fields.description:
Retrieves a 30-day climate forecast based on latitude and longitude.
Provides daily average temperatures and other long-term weather indicators.

args.name: input
args.description: Latitude and longitude coordinates of the location.

args.name: options
args.description: Additional options such as units, language, and forecast days count.

types.name: Forecast5
types.description: Represents the 5-day weather forecast data.

fields.name: city
fields.description: The city for which the forecast is generated.

fields.name: cnt
fields.description: The number of forecasted time slots returned.

fields.name: cod
fields.description: The response code from the API.

fields.name: list
fields.description: A list of forecast entries, each representing weather data for a specific time period.

fields.name: message
fields.description: A system message, which can be ignored in most cases.

types.name: Forecast5List
types.description: Represents a single forecast entry with weather details for a specific time.

fields.name: clouds
fields.description: The cloudiness percentage.

fields.name: dt
fields.description: The timestamp (Unix time) for the forecast entry.

fields.name: dt_txt
fields.description: The date and time of the forecast entry.

fields.name: feels_like
fields.description: The perceived temperature (feels-like temperature).

fields.name: main
fields.description: Represents a single forecast entry with weather details for a specific time.

fields.name: pop
fields.description: The probability of precipitation (0 to 1).

fields.name: rain
fields.description: The forecasted rain volume.

fields.name: snow
fields.description: The forecasted snow volume.

fields.name: sys
fields.description: Part of the day (n - night, d - day)

fields.name: temp
fields.description: The actual temperature forecasted.

fields.name: visibility
fields.description: The visibility distance in meters.

fields.name: weather
fields.description: A list of weather conditions applicable to this forecast entry.

fields.name: wind
fields.description: Wind data, including wind speed, direction, and gusts.

types.name: Forecast5Main
types.description: Represents the forecasted temperature for a specific time.

fields.name: feels_like
fields.description: The "feels-like" temperature in degrees Celsius.

fields.name: grnd_level
fields.description: The atmospheric pressure at ground level in hPa.

fields.name: humidity
fields.description: The humidity percentage.

fields.name: pressure
fields.description: The atmospheric pressure in hPa.

fields.name: sea_level
fields.description: The atmospheric pressure at sea level in hPa.

fields.name: temp
fields.description: The temperature in degrees Celsius.

fields.name: temp_kf
fields.description: The temperature coefficient.

fields.name: temp_max
fields.description: The maximum temperature in degrees Celsius.

fields.name: temp_min
fields.description: The minimum temperature in degrees Celsius.

types.name: Forecast5Options
types.description: Input parameters for fetching the 5-day weather forecast.

inputFields.name: cnt
inputFields.description: The number of forecast data points to return.

inputFields.name: lang
inputFields.description: The language for the API response.

inputFields.name: units
inputFields.description: The units of measurement (e.g., metric, imperial).

types.name: Forecast5Rain
types.description: Represents the forecasted rain volume for a three-hour period.

fields.name: three_hour
fields.description: The amount of rain in millimeters for a three-hour period.

types.name: Forecast5Snow
types.description: Represents the forecasted snow volume for a three-hour period.

fields.name: three_hour
fields.description: The amount of snow in millimeters for a three-hour period.

fields.name: pod
fields.description: Part of the day (n - night, d - day)

types.name: Forecast16
types.description: Represents the full 16-day weather forecast response.

fields.name: city
fields.description: Details about the city for which the forecast is provided.

fields.name: cnt
fields.description: Number of forecast days returned in the response.

fields.name: cod
fields.description: Response code from the API (e.g., "200" for success).

fields.name: list
fields.description: List of daily forecasts for up to 16 days.

fields.name: message
fields.description: Additional API response message or error description.

types.name: Forecast16List
types.description: Represents a single day's weather forecast in the 16-day forecast.

fields.name: clouds
fields.description: Cloudiness percentage, ranging from 0 to 100.

fields.name: deg
fields.description: Wind direction, expressed in degrees (meteorological).

fields.name: dt
fields.description: The timestamp of the forecasted data in Unix format (UTC).

fields.name: feels_like
fields.description: Temperature values that indicate how the temperature feels to the human body.

fields.name: gust
fields.description: Wind gust speed, measured in meters per second.

fields.name: humidity
fields.description: Humidity percentage, ranging from 0 to 100.

fields.name: pop
fields.description: Probability of precipitation, represented as a float between 0 and 1.

fields.name: pressure
fields.description: Atmospheric pressure on the sea level, measured in hPa (hectopascals).

fields.name: rain
fields.description: Expected amount of rain, measured in millimeters.

fields.name: snow
fields.description: Expected amount of snowfall, measured in millimeters.

fields.name: speed
fields.description: Wind speed, measured in meters per second.

fields.name: sunrise
fields.description: The time of sunrise for the given day in Unix format (UTC).

fields.name: sunset
fields.description: The time of sunset for the given day in Unix format (UTC).

fields.name: temp
fields.description: Temperature details, including daily, minimum, and maximum values.

fields.name: weather
fields.description: An array of weather condition details, such as description and icon.

types.name: Forecast16Options
types.description: Options for customizing the 16-day weather forecast request.

inputFields.name: cnt
inputFields.description: Number of days to retrieve (maximum 16).

inputFields.name: lang
inputFields.description:
Language for weather descriptions.
Example: "en" for English, "es" for Spanish.

inputFields.name: units
inputFields.description:
Unit format for temperature and wind speed.
Example: "metric" (Celsius, m/s) or "imperial" (Fahrenheit, mph).

types.name: Forecast30
types.description: Represents the 30-day weather forecast response.

fields.name: city
fields.description: Details about the city for which the forecast is provided.

fields.name: cod
fields.description: Response code from the API (e.g., "200" for success).

fields.name: list
fields.description:
List of daily forecasts for up to 30 days.
Each entry contains temperature, weather conditions, and other atmospheric details.

fields.name: message
fields.description: Additional API response message or error description.

types.name: Forecast30Options
types.description: Options for customizing the 30-day weather forecast request.

inputFields.name: cnt
inputFields.description: Number of days to retrieve (maximum 30).

inputFields.name: lang
inputFields.description:
Language for weather descriptions.
Example: "en" for English, "es" for Spanish.

inputFields.name: units
inputFields.description:
Unit format for temperature and wind speed.
Example: "metric" (Celsius, m/s) or "imperial" (Fahrenheit, mph).

types.name: Geocoding
types.description: Provides geocoding services, including direct, reverse, and ZIP code-based lookups.

fields.name: direct
fields.description: Searches for a location by name, returning latitude, longitude, and country details.

fields.name: reverse
fields.description: Performs reverse geocoding using latitude and longitude to find a location.

fields.name: zip
fields.description: Finds location details based on a given ZIP code.

fields.name: coordinates
fields.description: The coordinates of the geometry, represented as an array of arrays for complex shapes.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of geometry (e.g., "Polygon", "Point", etc.).

inputFields.name: abstractTypeName
inputFields.description: The name of the interface or union type.

inputFields.name: conditions
inputFields.description: The conditions to resolve the type.

fields.name: get
fields.description: Fetch a specific trigger history event using the trigger ID and history ID.

fields.name: list
fields.description: Fetch a list of past trigger events associated with a specific trigger ID.

types.name: HourlyForecast
types.description: Represents the hourly weather forecast response.

fields.name: city
fields.description: Details about the city for which the forecast is provided.

fields.name: cnt
fields.description: Number of forecasted hours returned in the response.

fields.name: cod
fields.description: Response code from the API (e.g., "200" for success).

fields.name: list
fields.description: List of hourly forecast data, including temperature, weather conditions, and atmospheric details.

fields.name: message
fields.description: Additional API response message or error description.

types.name: HourlyForecastOptions
types.description: Options for customizing the hourly weather forecast request.

inputFields.name: cnt
inputFields.description: Number of hours to retrieve in the forecast.

inputFields.name: lang
inputFields.description:
Language for weather descriptions.
Example: "en" for English, "es" for Spanish.

inputFields.name: units
inputFields.description:
Unit format for temperature and wind speed.
Example: "metric" (Celsius, m/s) or "imperial" (Fahrenheit, mph).

fields.name: _id
fields.description: The unique identifier for the area, used to identify geographical regions.

fields.name: coordinates
fields.description: The coordinates for the area in GeoJSON format.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of the area, such as Point, MultiPoint, Polygon, or MultiPolygon.

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: JSON
types.description: The `JSON` scalar type represents JSON values as specified by [ECMA-404](http://www.ecma-international.org/publications/files/ECMA-ST/ECMA-404.pdf).

types.name: JSONObject
types.description: The `JSONObject` scalar type represents JSON objects as specified by [ECMA-404](http://www.ecma-international.org/publications/files/ECMA-ST/ECMA-404.pdf).

inputFields.name: lat
inputFields.description: Latitude coordinate (e.g., "34.0522").

inputFields.name: lon
inputFields.description: Longitude coordinate (e.g., "-118.2437").

types.name: LocalNames
types.description:
Represents localized names of locations in various languages.
Each field corresponds to a language code, such as:
- `en`: English
- `fr`: French
- `es`: Spanish
- `zh`: Chinese
- `ru`: Russian
- and many more...

fields.name: ascii
fields.description: Name of the location in ASCII characters.

fields.name: feature_name
fields.description: Feature name associated with the location.

fields.name: feels_like
fields.description: The "feels-like" temperature in degrees Celsius.

fields.name: grnd_level
fields.description: Atmospheric pressure at the ground level, in hPa (hectopascals).

fields.name: humidity
fields.description: Humidity percentage in the air.

fields.name: pressure
fields.description: Atmospheric pressure at the sea level, in hPa (hectopascals).

fields.name: sea_level
fields.description: Atmospheric pressure at the sea level, in hPa (hectopascals).

fields.name: temp
fields.description: Temperature in degrees Celsius (Kelvin for default unit).

fields.name: temp_kf
fields.description: Temperature coefficient, used for indicating adjustments (e.g., for air pressure in weather models).

fields.name: temp_max
fields.description: Maximum temperature at the moment (usually for the day).

fields.name: temp_min
fields.description: Minimum temperature at the moment (usually for the day).

fields.name: _id
fields.description: Represents a multi-point area. A set of multiple points in 2D space.

fields.name: multi_point_coordinates
fields.description: The multi-point coordinates, represented as a 2D array of float pairs (longitude, latitude).

fields.name: _id
fields.description: Represents a multi-polygon area. A collection of multiple polygons.

fields.name: multi_polygon_coordinates
fields.description: The multi-polygon coordinates, represented as a 4D array of float values (multiple polygons with coordinates for each).

fields.name: api
fields.description: Mutation to access the API with an appid (API key) for weather-related mutation operations.

fields.name: trigger
fields.description: The trigger mutation allows you to add, update, and delete triggers related to weather conditions.

fields.name: _id
fields.description: Represents a point area. A single set of coordinates in 2D space (longitude, latitude).

fields.name: point_coordinates
fields.description: The point coordinates, represented as an array of floats (longitude, latitude).

fields.name: _id
fields.description: Represents a polygon area. A closed shape with multiple points (e.g., a rectangle or triangle).

fields.name: polygon_coordinates
fields.description: The polygon coordinates, represented as a 3D array of float values (longitude, latitude, and potentially altitude).

fields.name: _id
fields.description: Represents a polygon area with a hole inside it. The hole is defined by a second set of points.

fields.name: polygon_with_hole_coordinates
fields.description: The polygon with hole coordinates, represented as a 3D array with two sets of points: one for the outer polygon and one for the hole.

fields.name: api
fields.description: Query to access the API with an appid (API key) for weather data.

fields.name: ping
fields.description: Test query to check if the server is running.

inputFields.name: jsonPath
inputFields.description: The field to replace.

inputFields.name: maxDate
inputFields.description: The maximum value of the date.

inputFields.name: maxLength
inputFields.description: The maximum length of the string.

inputFields.name: maxValue
inputFields.description: The maximum value of the number.

inputFields.name: minDate
inputFields.description: The minimum value of the date.

inputFields.name: minLength
inputFields.description: The minimum length of the string.

inputFields.name: minValue
inputFields.description: The minimum value of the number.

inputFields.name: pattern
inputFields.description: The pattern to match the string.

inputFields.name: stringValues
inputFields.description: The values the string can be.

inputFields.name: jsonPath
inputFields.description: The field to replace.

inputFields.name: newKey
inputFields.description: The replacement key.

types.name: Reverse
types.description: Represents location details retrieved using latitude and longitude.

fields.name: country
fields.description: Country code in ISO 3166 format.

fields.name: lat
fields.description: Latitude coordinate of the location.

fields.name: local_names
fields.description: Localized names of the location in various languages.

fields.name: lon
fields.description: Longitude coordinate of the location.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the location (e.g., city or town).

fields.name: state
fields.description: Name of the state or region where the location is situated.

types.name: ReverseInput
types.description: Input parameters for reverse geocoding queries.

inputFields.name: lat
inputFields.description: Latitude coordinate for the reverse geocoding lookup.

inputFields.name: limit
inputFields.description: Limit the number of results returned (default: no limit).

inputFields.name: lon
inputFields.description: Longitude coordinate for the reverse geocoding lookup.

types.name: Road
types.description: Represents the state and temperature of the road at a given location.

fields.name: state
fields.description:
Numerical representation of the road state, where different values may indicate
conditions such as dry, wet, icy, or snow-covered.

fields.name: temp
fields.description: Temperature of the road surface in degrees Celsius.

types.name: RoadRisk
types.description: Represents road risk data, including weather conditions, road state, and alerts.

fields.name: alerts
fields.description: List of alerts indicating potential hazards due to weather or road conditions.

fields.name: coord
fields.description: Coordinates (latitude, longitude) of the location for which the road risk data applies.

fields.name: dt
fields.description: Timestamp in Unix format (UTC) representing the time for which the data is provided.

fields.name: road
fields.description: Information about the road state and surface temperature.

fields.name: weather
fields.description: Weather conditions affecting road risk at the given location.

types.name: RoadRiskAlert
types.description: Represents an alert related to road risk conditions.

fields.name: event
fields.description: Type of event causing the alert, such as heavy rain, ice, or fog.

fields.name: event_level
fields.description: Severity level of the event. Higher values indicate more severe conditions.

fields.name: sender_name
fields.description: Name of the sender issuing the alert.

types.name: RoadRiskInput
types.description: Input parameters for retrieving road risk data.

inputFields.name: tracks
inputFields.description: List of track points containing location coordinates and timestamps to assess road risk.

types.name: RoadRiskWeather
types.description: Represents the weather conditions that impact road risk.

fields.name: dew_point
fields.description:
Dew point temperature in degrees Celsius, indicating the temperature at which air
becomes saturated with moisture and condensation begins.

fields.name: precipitation_intensity
fields.description: Intensity of precipitation (rain or snow) in millimeters per hour (mm/h).

fields.name: temp
fields.description: Current air temperature in degrees Celsius.

fields.name: wind_deg
fields.description: Wind direction in degrees, where 0° represents north, 90° east, 180° south, and 270° west.

fields.name: wind_speed
fields.description: Wind speed at the given location, measured in meters per second (m/s).

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

fields.name: country
fields.description: The country code associated with the city or location, for example, "US" for the United States or "IN" for India.

fields.name: id
fields.description: An identifier for the system. This ID is specific to the data provider system.

fields.name: sunrise
fields.description: The sunrise time in UTC, expressed as seconds since the Unix epoch (1970-01-01).

fields.name: sunset
fields.description: The sunset time in UTC, expressed as seconds since the Unix epoch (1970-01-01).

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of the system. Represents information about the data provider system.

fields.name: day
fields.description: Daytime temperature, in degrees Celsius.

fields.name: eve
fields.description: Evening temperature, in degrees Celsius.

fields.name: max
fields.description: Maximum temperature for the day, in degrees Celsius.

fields.name: min
fields.description: Minimum temperature for the day, in degrees Celsius.

fields.name: morn
fields.description: Morning temperature, in degrees Celsius.

fields.name: night
fields.description: Nighttime temperature, in degrees Celsius.

fields.name: end
fields.description: The end time period for the trigger, defined with a specific expression and amount.

fields.name: start
fields.description: The start time period for the trigger, defined with a specific expression and amount.

enumValues.name: after
enumValues.description: The condition will be met after the specified time.

enumValues.name: before
enumValues.description: The condition will be met before the specified time.

enumValues.name: exact
enumValues.description: The condition will be met exactly at the specified time.

types.name: TrackInput
types.description: Represents a track point containing latitude, longitude, and timestamp.

inputFields.name: dt
inputFields.description: Timestamp in Unix format (UTC) for which the road risk data is requested.

inputFields.name: lat
inputFields.description: Latitude coordinate of the location to assess.

inputFields.name: lon
inputFields.description: Longitude coordinate of the location to assess.

fields.name: _id
fields.description: The unique identifier for the trigger.

fields.name: _v
fields.description: The version of the trigger.

fields.name: alerts
fields.description: The alerts associated with this trigger, stored as a JSON object.

fields.name: area
fields.description: A list of geographical areas associated with the trigger.

fields.name: conditions
fields.description: A list of conditions that must be met for the trigger to be activated.

fields.name: time_period
fields.description: The time period for which the trigger is valid. This includes both start and end times.

inputFields.name: type
inputFields.description: Defines the area for the trigger. The type of the area (e.g., Point, MultiPoint, Polygon, MultiPolygon) and the coordinates.

inputFields.name: amount
inputFields.description: The amount for the condition expression (e.g., a temperature threshold).

inputFields.name: expression
inputFields.description: The expression used to evaluate the condition (e.g., greater than, less than).

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: The name of the condition, e.g., "temperature", "humidity".

inputFields.name: area
inputFields.description: The area or geographical regions associated with the trigger.

inputFields.name: conditions
inputFields.description: A list of conditions that must be met for the trigger to be activated.

inputFields.name: time_period
inputFields.description: The time period during which the trigger is valid.

fields.name: add
fields.description: Add a new trigger with the specified input data.

fields.name: delete
fields.description: Delete a trigger using the specified trigger ID.

fields.name: update
fields.description: Update an existing trigger using the provided trigger ID and new input data.

fields.name: get
fields.description: Fetch a specific trigger by its ID.

fields.name: history
fields.description: Fetch historical data related to triggers.

fields.name: list
fields.description: Fetch a list of triggers based on the app ID.

inputFields.name: amount
inputFields.description: The amount of time (in the specified units) for the time period.

inputFields.name: expression
inputFields.description: The time period expression, such as exact, before, or after.

inputFields.name: end
inputFields.description: The end time period for the trigger.

inputFields.name: start
inputFields.description: The start time period for the trigger.

enumValues.name: MultiPoint
enumValues.description: Represents a multi-point area, defined by a set of multiple coordinates.

enumValues.name: MultiPolygon
enumValues.description: Represents a multi-polygon area, defined by multiple polygons.

enumValues.name: Point
enumValues.description: Represents a point area, defined by a single set of coordinates (longitude, latitude).

enumValues.name: Polygon
enumValues.description: Represents a polygon area, defined by a closed set of coordinates.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The amount of time (in the specified units) for the time period.

fields.name: expression
fields.description: The time period expression, such as exact, before, or after.

inputFields.name: arrayLength
inputFields.description: The value to compare.

inputFields.name: equals
inputFields.description: The value to compare.

inputFields.name: jsonPath
inputFields.description: The JSON path to the field to compare.

enumValues.name: imperial
enumValues.description: Imperial unit for temperature in Fahrenheit, wind speed in miles per hour, and pressure in inches of mercury.

enumValues.name: metric
enumValues.description: Metric unit for temperature in Celsius, wind speed in meters per second, and pressure in hPa.

enumValues.name: standard
enumValues.description: Standard unit for temperature, pressure, and wind speed.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Detailed description of the weather condition within the group.

fields.name: icon
fields.description: Icon identifier that represents the weather condition, used for fetching corresponding weather icons.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the weather condition (e.g., 200 for thunderstorm).

fields.name: main
fields.description: Group of weather parameters, such as Rain, Snow, Extreme, etc.

fields.name: deg
fields.description: Wind direction in degrees. A meteorological measurement where 0° is north, 90° is east, 180° is south, and 270° is west.

fields.name: gust
fields.description:
Wind gust speed in the specified unit.
Unit default: meter/sec, Metric: meter/sec, Imperial: miles/hour.

fields.name: speed
fields.description:
Wind speed in the specified unit.
Unit default: meter/sec, Metric: meter/sec, Imperial: miles/hour.

types.name: Zip
types.description: Represents location details for a given ZIP code.

fields.name: country
fields.description: Country code in ISO 3166 format (e.g., "US" for the United States).

fields.name: lat
fields.description: Latitude coordinate of the location.

fields.name: lon
fields.description: Longitude coordinate of the location.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the location (e.g., city or town).

fields.name: zip
fields.description: The postal or ZIP code of the location.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByURL`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: oneOf
directives.description: Indicates exactly one field must be supplied and this field must not be `null`.

args.name: constraints
args.description: The constraints to apply to the request body.

args.name: keyReplacements
args.description: The keys to replace in the request body.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.
